title: Airline Takeoff Is Leaving Inflation Behind
sub_head: Updates from Delta Air Lines, American Airlines and easyJet suggest travelers are willing to endure higher airfares
body:
After many false starts, today’s period of inflation and geopolitical turmoil may be the time for airline investors to prepare for takeoff.
Delta Air Lines recorded sales of $9.3 billion in the first quarter of the year, significantly above the $8.8 billion that Wall Street was forecasting. Most came from pent-up consumer demand powering through the rise in airfares—which, according to U.S. official data, are 24% higher than a year ago.
